name: Large Language Model Service
description: Managed LLM gateway providing text generation, summarization, and reasoning capabilities across all AI use cases

name: Inference Engine
description: High-performance model serving infrastructure enabling real-time predictions with sub-second latency

name: Natural Language Generation
description: Transforms structured data into human-readable narratives for reports, summaries, and customer communications

name: Data Drift Detector
description: Monitors input data distributions to detect statistical shifts that may degrade model performance over time

name: Vector Database
description: Stores and retrieves high-dimensional embeddings for semantic search, RAG, and similarity matching

name: Agent Orchestrator
description: Manages autonomous AI agent lifecycles, coordinating multi-step task execution and tool invocation

name: Feature Store
description: Central repository serving consistent ML features for training and inference with versioning support

name: ML Model Explainability Engine
description: Generates SHAP/LIME explanations for model predictions to support regulatory compliance and trust

name: Semantic Search Engine
description: Enables meaning-based document and knowledge retrieval using vector similarity and embeddings

name: NLP Extraction Engine
description: Extracts named entities, relationships, and key information from unstructured text documents

name: Intent Classifier
description: Determines user intent from natural language inputs to route conversations and trigger actions

name: Document Classification Engine
description: Automatically categorizes documents by type, content, and risk level for processing workflows

name: Business Metrics Tracker
description: Correlates model predictions with business outcomes to measure ROI and operational impact

name: Validation Engine
description: Ensures data quality and model output integrity through configurable validation rules and checks

name: Stakeholder Dashboard
description: Executive-level visibility into AI platform health, adoption metrics, and business value delivered

name: Response Generator
description: Produces contextually appropriate conversational responses for chatbots and virtual assistants

name: Online Feature Store
description: Low-latency feature serving for real-time inference with millisecond response requirements

name: Event Broker
description: Asynchronous message bus enabling event-driven communication between AI platform components

name: Model Router
description: Intelligently routes inference requests to optimal models based on cost, latency, or capability

name: Batch Orchestrator
description: Schedules and manages large-scale batch prediction jobs with retry logic and monitoring

name: Conversation State Manager
description: Maintains multi-turn dialogue context and session history for coherent conversations

name: Entity Extractor
description: Identifies and extracts named entities (people, orgs, dates) from conversational inputs

name: Multi-Channel Orchestrator
description: Coordinates consistent AI experiences across web, mobile, voice, and messaging channels

name: Audit Trail & Logging
description: Captures comprehensive audit logs of AI decisions and actions for compliance and forensics

name: Human-in-the-Loop Gateway
description: Enables human review and approval of AI agent actions for high-risk decisions

name: OCR Engine
description: Converts scanned documents and images into machine-readable text for downstream processing

name: Document Processing Pipeline
description: Ingests, parses, chunks, and prepares documents for RAG and knowledge extraction

name: Data Lineage Tracker
description: Traces data provenance from source to model prediction for regulatory and debugging needs

name: Stream Processing Engine
description: Real-time event processing for streaming data transformation and feature computation

name: Observability Platform
description: Unified monitoring of metrics, logs, and traces across all AI platform components

name: Traffic Splitter
description: Distributes inference traffic between model versions for A/B testing and canary deployments

name: Handoff Logic Engine
description: Manages seamless escalation from AI assistants to human agents based on context and rules

name: Compliance Dashboard
description: Tracks AI governance metrics, model approvals, and regulatory compliance status

name: Knowledge Base
description: Structured repository of domain knowledge, policies, and FAQs for AI retrieval

name: Model Testing Framework
description: Comprehensive testing suite for model validation including unit, integration, and bias tests

name: GenAI Quality Monitor
description: Evaluates LLM output quality for hallucination, toxicity, and response faithfulness

name: Tool Registry
description: Catalog of available tools and APIs that AI agents can invoke during task execution

name: Execution Engine
description: Runtime environment executing agent plans by invoking tools and managing state

name: Sentiment Analyzer
description: Detects emotional tone and sentiment polarity in customer interactions and feedback

name: Citation Generator
description: Attributes LLM responses to source documents for transparency and verification

name: Latency Monitor
description: Tracks end-to-end response times across inference pipelines to ensure SLA compliance

name: Data Quality Monitor
description: Continuously monitors data completeness, accuracy, and freshness metrics

name: Explanation Visualization Layer
description: Renders model explanations as interactive charts and visualizations for stakeholders

name: Multi-Agent Communication Bus
description: Message infrastructure enabling coordination and information sharing between agents

name: Data Quality Validator
description: Validates batch data against schema and quality rules before model training or inference

name: Conversation Summarizer
description: Generates concise summaries of multi-turn conversations for agent handoffs and records

name: Data Lake
description: Scalable storage for raw and processed data supporting ML training and analytics

name: Document Forensics Engine
description: Detects document tampering, forgery, and fraud through metadata and content analysis

name: Hybrid Search Engine
description: Combines keyword-based and semantic search for optimal retrieval precision and recall

name: Model Fallback Logic
description: Implements graceful degradation strategies when primary models fail or timeout

description: Initiates model retraining workflows when drift thresholds are exceeded

name: Audit Logging & Monitoring
description: Security-focused logging for threat detection and incident investigation

name: Human-in-the-Loop Workflow
description: Orchestrates human review queues and approval workflows for AI-assisted decisions

name: Planning Module
description: Generates execution plans for complex multi-step tasks requiring agent reasoning

name: Incremental Processing Manager
description: Optimizes batch jobs by processing only new or changed data since last run

name: Performance Comparator
description: Compares champion vs challenger model metrics to inform promotion decisions

name: Data Versioning Service
description: Tracks dataset versions with lineage for reproducible model training

name: Data Product Catalog
description: Discoverable inventory of curated data products available across the organization

name: Domain Data Platform

description: Automates feature transformation, aggregation, and enrichment workflows

description: Batch feature storage for model training with point-in-time correctness

description: Expands and reformulates queries for better semantic search coverage

description: Protects models from adversarial attacks, extraction, and unauthorized access
